item.title: Rachel add a quote by The Apostle Paul
item.description: "I have fought the good fight, I have finished the course, I have kept the faith" -- The Apostle Paul

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Isaiah 52:7
item.description: "How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!" -- Isaiah 52:7

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Respect for self is the beginning of cultivating virtue in men and women." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "What a stupendous, what an incomprehensible machine is man! Who can endure toil, famine, stripes, imprisonment and death itself in vindication of his own liberty, and the next moment . . . inflict on his fellow men a bondage, one hour of which is fraught with more misery than ages of that which he rose in rebellion to oppose." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Sharon Creech
item.description: "Then I thought, boy, isn't that just typical? You wait and wait and wait for something, and then when it happens, you feel sad." -- Sharon Creech

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "There is nothing sweeter in this sad world than the sound of someone you love calling your name." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is only a novel... or, in short, only some work in which the greatest powers of the mind are displayed, in which the most thorough knowledge of human nature, the happiest delineation of its varieties, the liveliest effusions of wit and humour, are conveyed to the world in the best-chosen language" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Angry people are not always wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What strange creatures brothers are!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Give a girl an education and introduce her properly into the world, and ten to one but she has the means of settling well, without further expense to anybody. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A person who can write a long letter with ease, cannot write ill." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I think the only way to get through this life is laughing hard and constantly, mostly at myself." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I was under the stars, like a fish is under water." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "You are my butterfly and refuse to set you free." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "Its important to know stories. I felt the earth shift to make a place for you when you were born, and I came to tell you stories while you are young. And like me, you were born with a word on your tongue." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "I've watched through his eyes, I've listened through his ears, and I tell you he's the one." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "If you try and lose then it isn't your fault. But if you don't try and we lose, then it's all your fault." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "To reach out to you when I'm in need, and to try to be here for you when you need me back. And to feel such tenderness when I look at you that I want to stand between you and all the world: and yet also to lift you up and carry you above the strong currents of life; and at the same time, I would be glad to stand always like this, at a distance, watching you, the beauty of you." -- Orson Scott Card
